1.text: Cover the chickpeas with 2 in (5 cm) of water and soak them overnight.

3.text: Mix the chickpeas with baking soda and cook them for 3 minutes.

4.text: Cover the chickpeas with 2 inches (5.1 cm) of water and bring it to a boil.

5.text: Simmer the chickpeas for 45 to 60 minutes over medium-low heat.

6.text: Turn off the burner and scoop away the loose chickpea skins.

7.text: Drain the chickpeas and reserve 1 cup (240 ml) of the cooking water.

8.text: Blend the garlic and chickpeas for 3 to 4 minutes.

9.text: Blend in the tahini, salt, juice, and reserved chickpea liquid.

11.text: Drain and rinse 1 can of chickpeas.

12.text: Put the chickpeas in a food processor with oil, tahini, juice, and garlic.

13.text: Blend the ingredients for 3 to 5 minutes.

14.text: Add the salt and pepper and taste the hummus.
